articles.title: February 16 Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
February 16 Celebrated in Different Countries 
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting and a book and photo exhibition were held in Sri Lanka and Ecuador on Feb. 6 and 22 on the occasion of the February holiday.
 The Sri Lankan minister of Justice, addressing the meeting, said that the revolutionary activity of leader Kim Jong Il is consistent with the struggle to carry forward and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung. Thanks to his Songun politics, he said, the Korean people will win a greater victory.    
 Reggie Ranatunge, chairman of the Sri Lanka-People's Korea Friendship Association, noted that it is under the wise leadership of respected Kim Jong Il that the Korean people are giving full play to the might of Korean-style socialism without the slightest vacillation despite the U.S. moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK.
 Trotsky Serano, international secretary of the Socialist Party-Ample Front of Ecuador who is president of the Canar Provincial Institute for Friendship and Solidarity with the DPRK of Ecuador, stated that Marshal Kim Jong Il has equipped himself with the personality and qualification of a leader of people from his childhood after he was born on Mt. Paektu and is respected and revered by the progressive humankind of the world as the genius of military affairs and a veteran statesman. The greatest one of his exploits is to pursue the Songun politics, said Serano.

articles.title: Cancel of "Bill on Part-time Job" Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Cancel of "Bill on Part-time Job" Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Organizations of lawyers in south Korea including the Bar Association for Democratic Society held a press conference in front of the building of the "National Assembly" on Mar. 1 to demand the cancel of the "bill on part-time job", according to the south Korean MBC.
 The organizations charged that the bill was railroaded through the "Environment and Labor Committee of the National Assembly" by a secret-room conspiracy between the ruling and opposition parties without public consent. And they stressed that the bill may give unlimited permission to contractual employment and expand substantial dispatch of labour to bring about unrest of employment.

articles.title: Opening of June 15 Era of Reunification Called for
articles.content:
Opening of June 15 Era of Reunification Called for 
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity of Youth and Students for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea reportedly made public a statement on March 1 on the occasion of the 87th anniversary of the March First Popular Uprising.
 The spirit of the March first movement for independence is continuously inherited in the June 15 era, the statement said, stressing that all the fellow countrymen out in the movement for independent reunification would wipe out the U.S. and pro-American conservative forces with a powerful anti-U.S. resistance.    
 No matter how desperately the U.S. and pro-American conservative forces may try to block national reconciliation, cooperation and reunification, they cannot check the nationwide trend for independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity, the statement noted, adding that youths and students would take the lead in the struggle to open up the June 15 era of reunification in the spirit of national independence.

articles.title: Resignation of Lawmaker from GNP Demanded
articles.content:
Resignation of Lawmaker from GNP Demanded 
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Uri Party of south Korea demanded Choe Yon Hui, former secretary general of the Grand National Party, resign his seat in the "National Assembly" for his molestation of a woman journalist, according to the south Korean KBS on March 1.
 A spokesman for the Uri Party in a press interview disclosed that sexual abuser Choe is just waiting for the situation to be eased in hiding after leaving the GNP, demanding he own the responsibility for the case and resign the post of the lawmaker.
 On the same day, the south Korean Council of Woman Student Representatives in a statement accused Choe of making shameless and illogical excuses that "he was so drunk that he took her for a hostess of the restaurant" in a bid to shirk his responsibility, and demanded he resign the post of lawmaker.

articles.title: S. Korean Religionists Clarify Stance on Reunification
articles.content:
S. Korean Religionists Clarify Stance on Reunification 
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Religious Committee of the Advisory Council for Democracy and Peaceful Reunification made up of representatives of Christian, Buddhist, Chondoist, Catholic, Round Buddhist and other religious organizations reportedly clarified the stance of the religionists on reunification on February 28.
 The committee held that laws should be readjusted for the effectuation of the July 4 South-North Joint Statement and the June 15 joint declaration in order to achieve peace on the Korean Peninsula and promote the reconciliation and cooperation between the south and the north of Korea.    
 Calling upon the authorities to readjust the leftovers of the  Cold War still remaining in laws including the "National Security Law" and regulations, the committee stressed that although this kind of work has been proposed late, there is no reason to hesitate to do so if it is badly needed for the south-north reconciliation.

Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
    Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A new souvenir sheet has been issued to commemorate the publication of the first stamps in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
 The government brought out two kinds of stamps including "Samson Rock", the first of their kinds in the democratic Korea after liberation, on March 12, Juche 35(1946), upholding the instruction of President   Kim Il Sung that new stamps should be made to be congenial to the reality of the country and life emotion of the people.
 Printed on the souvenir sheet are the words "In commemoration of the 60th anniversary of the publication of the first stamps in the DPRK" and "Juche35 (1946)-Juche95 (2006)".    
 It depicts the Samson Rock, flanked by pictures showing communication means such as airplane, railroad train, ship and TV relay tower.
 Its face value is 158 won.
